message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
public Iterator<Entry<String, Map<String, String>>> iterator() {
    return centralMap.entrySet().iterator();
}

// Usage
Iterator<Entry<String, Map<String, String>>> it = iterator();
while(it.hasNext()){
    Entry<String, Map<String, String>> entry = it.next();
    String key1 = entry.getKey();
    Map<String, String> nestedMap = entry.getValue();
    for(Entry<String, String> nestedEntry : nestedMap.entrySet()){
        String key2 = nestedEntry.getKey();
        String value = nestedEntry.getValue();
        // Do something with key1, key2, and value
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The iterator() method returns an iterator over the entries in the centralMap. Each entry is a key-value pair where the key is a String and the value is another Map. To iterate over the nested map, you can use a for-each loop on the entrySet of the nested map. This will give you access to each key-value pair in the nested map. If you want to remove an element, you can call it.remove() after calling it.next(). This will remove the last element returned by it.next() from the underlying collection.
